subject: Platform Week 2022 Wrap-Up

action.text: Rica Rosario Valencia marked as Closed

full_threads.body:
What you might have missed during Platform Week.
You can also view this email as a webpage.
When we kicked off Platform Week, we talked about the promise of pulling together solutions to build something great. We want developers to have the freedom and flexibility to build what they want, where they want. Each day during the week we made announcements supporting this promise. Starting with Monday when we announced a number of standards and open-source initiatives including the Web-interoperable runtimes community group, Managed Components for Zaraz, and our intention to open-source Workers. We followed through on the week showing how customers are using Cloudflare to implement those standards.

If you missed a few of the announcements (that's ok we had over 30), below is a recap of some of the highlights, and a challenge for you to participate in.

Visit the Platform Week Hub to see a list of everything announced during the week.
Platform Week Recap
Developer Challenges

Did seeing all the announcements spark ideas of what you can build with Cloudflare? We're kicking off a developer challenge. Submit your entry for a chance to earn some cool Cloudflare swag.

Learn more >
Workers for Platforms

We announced Workers for Platforms, our tool suite to help make any product programmable, and help our customers deliver value to their customers and developers instantaneously.

Learn more >
R2 now in beta

R2 is an S3-compatible, distributed object storage with zero-egress fees. Explore what you can create without the worry of exorbitant egress fees.

Learn more >
Introducing D1

We're expanding our storage offerings even more with Cloudflare's first database built on Durable Objects and SQLite. Cloudflare now supports an embedded database to use within the Workers ecosystem, giving developers an easy way to store and access data from their Workers.

Learn more >
Introducing Pub/Sub

Move your business logic off devices and onto Cloudflare's serverless computing platform with Pub/Sub, a message bus built on the industry-standard MQTT protocol.

Learn more >
Web3 Gateway Early Access

Our IPFS and Ethereum gateways eliminate the need for developers to run IPFS nodes or browser integrations when building Web3 applications.

Learn more >
We welcomed 12 guests to CloudflareTV to participate in our Developer Speaker Series. If you missed the sessions you can watch them on demand.

Watch on demand >
Looking for a place to talk with your peers about everything we announced? Join the Cloudflare Developers Discord.

This email was sent to lannarehab@wpperk.com because you are signed up to receive product news and promotions communications from Cloudflare. If you don't wish to receive product news and promotions communications in the future, you may unsubscribe. If you would like to unsubscribe from all communications click here.
